page.title: 05Physical Features.
page.content: The area of Shrewsbury we have been studying is called Harlescott and is found on the northern side of the town. The area is mostly agricultural in nature consisting of arable and small dairy farms, there is some areas of woodland but these are small and obviously remnants of much larger areas of woodland. Part of our area is made up of built up area most the housing estates of Harlescott including Mount Pleasant,Lancaster Road and the Grange areas. The area is served by two areas with small shops and also the Co-Op superstore on Lancaster Road. The factories in our area include the Tool and Die, Vickers Engines and Perkins, the Harlescott industrial Estate conatins a variety of small industries and businesses.
